newsitem.title: BRAZIL: Brazil Cardoso backs presidential re-election - paper.
newsitem.headline: Brazil Cardoso backs presidential re-election - paper.

text.p: Brazil's President Fernando Henrique Cardoso voiced support for the concept of presidential re-election in Brazil but sidestepped the issue of whether he was personally seeking a second term in office, Brazilian newspapers reported Wednesday.

While saying Tuesday that he backed a move to amend the constitution to allow re-election, he added that this matter was separate from his own political prospects, the Gazeta Mercantial newspaper said.

"What Congress needs to decide is a principle. And I have never been shy to support this principle. Another issue is the reelection of the current president and if he will be or not candidate," Cardoso was quoted as saying.
Cardoso made these comments at a news conference in Cochabamba, Bolivia, the site of the 10th presidential summit of the Rio Group of Latin American and Caribbean states.
Cardoso also said the government will follow the political forces' action in favor of re-election, the Folha de Sao Paulo daily said.
Folha also said Cardoso declined to comment on an widely-expected cabinet reshuffle after October's municipal elections.
Cardoso took office in January 1995 for a four-year term.
